intro: Derris confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered derris, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its production of rotenone, a natural pesticide, which makes it valuable in traditional agricultural practices. Its vines can grow up to several meters long, often climbing trees or shrubs in its natural habitat. Derris confertiflora is also used in traditional medicine for its various therapeutic properties.
